attributes.additional_details:
We call upon the Government to make June 14 Falklands Liberation Day in our national calendar.

May those who gave their lives Rest in Peace and Rise in Glory.
attributes.background:
Next year on June 14 sees the 40th anniversary of the liberation of the Falkland Islands.
255 British lives were lost during the conflict.

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for designating particular days or months for celebrating particular subjects.

We can accept petitions calling for new bank holidays related to particular events, as that is a specific action the Government can take.
